did.unittitle: Washtenaw County Historic District Commission sound cassettes and summaries
did.abstract: Oral history interviews with residents of Ann Arbor, Ypsilanti, and other Washtenaw County, Michigan, locales largely concerning their remembrances of their lives and activities during the late nineteenth and early twentieth century.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection came from the organization (donor no. 6127)

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Washtenaw County Historic District Commission sound cassettes and summaries, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Oral History Project was a volunteer program sponsored by the Washtenaw County Historic District Commission. The purpose was to gather information from long-time county residents that would normally not appear in the written records. The intent was to gather through interviews details about the life and color of a community or an industry or an ethnic group.

scopecontent.p: The sound recordings were received in different accessions depending mainly on the date of the interview. The first accession was largely made up of interviews conducted by the Ypsilanti Historical Society and related to the history of Ypsilanti and surrounding areas. The second accession is comprised of interviews with individuals relating to Ann Arbor business establishments. The later accessions were miscellaneous interviews on Ann Arbor and Washtenaw County history. Accompanying almost all of the interviews were summary sheets providing a condensation of the interview. The listing below notes the interviews which lack a summary.
The library has releases from about half of the interviewees. Interviews with releases are noted in the listing below.

Ann Arbor businesses and other topics

odd.p: (Subjects: Purity Bakery, Heusel's Bakery, Washtenaw Dairy, Ann Arbor Dairy.)
(concerning Marshall's Drugs. Cassette also includes: Paul Proud, Jr., March 3, 1978, concerning Goodyears and St. James)
Subjects: West Side, Ann Arbor Dairy.
Cassette also includes Pat and Mike Kelsey, March 22, 1978, concerning Kelsey's Market
Cassette also includes Dalene Smith, January 16, 1978, concerning her life and E. Wassem, January 21, 1978, concerning Farmer's Market.
(concerning a variety of stores and markets. Cassette also includes Betty and Betty Lutz, March 22, 1978, concerning Quality Bakery)
Cassette also includes Ron MacDougal, Feb 1, 1978, concerning Townley's (Food and Drug)
(concerning businesses and activities in Ann Arbor)
Cassette includes Walter Strickland, March 23, 1978, concerning Strickland's Market and George Wild, March 23, 1978, concerning Wild's Men Shop and Wild's Clothing Store.)
Cassette also includes Dick Weinmann, February 24, 1978, concerning Weinmann-Geisendorf (meat market); also Fischer Hardware)
